title: Senior Solution Developer to Core Ledger
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*  

Team Inlån Dev is looking for an Assembler/COBOL developer with a strong technical drive to join our existing team based in Stockholm.

You will be part of a professional team on a great transformative journey. One of SEB’s largest initiatives is found within the Core Ledger area where we are building a completely new ledger system. The current system INLÅN, (even known as the *Heart of the Bank*) is a deposit system in SEK, containing all the banks’ customers’ deposit- accounts; both private and cooperative will slowly be phased out. The system is built by SEB and runs on Mainframe.
Meanwhile developing the new ledger, securing our current business to be run with the same quality and efficiency as it has been since 1970, is still our major focus.

**The team is accountable for:*** Development and testing within the SEK deposit account ledger, INLÅN.
* Development and testing of common CS services within deposit application.
* Automation of tests
* LCM-activities


Cross-collaboration and interaction with other SEB teams with a focus on accuracy and timely delivery are the essence of our daily work.
**Your primary responsibilities will include:*** Develop and testing of services for INLÅN on the KTO platform and IMS/DB2
* Development and enabling of SEB’s largest initiatives (New Cash Ledger)
* Share information via MQ/KAFKA
* Analysis and design work
* Collaborating with people in our team and cross-teams


**Who we are looking for**
We believe you are an outgoing and positive team player who has a flexible mindset and a willingness to drive larger initiatives. You like to find creative solutions to complex problems. Since we are an agile team, using Scrum and SAFE as frameworks it is an advantage if you have worked in similar setups before. An analytical and curious mindset and previous experience in design work are well needed to succeed in this role. As a person, you are communicative, driven, and collaborative. Sharing knowledge comes naturally to you.

Furthermore, to succeed we think you have:
* Good knowledge of Assembler
* Good knowledge of Cobol and Mainframe environments e.g JCL, DB2, MQ, and KAFKA
* Fluent in English, both orally and written
* Proven track record of analytical/design work


**We offer**
We are a team of 18 highly motivated and engaged developers and testers. Always looking out for each other. We would love to welcome you to join our journey of future-proofing SEB’s core systems.
* Agile and modern way of working
* Deliver world-class service to customers
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Work-life balance
* Mentorship

**Learn more about working at SEB at** **www.sebgroup.com/career****at**It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.
**Ready to join?**
Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than August the 31st 2024. If you have questions about the position please contact Linda Asplund, Team Manager, by mail at linda.asplund@seb.se
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Expert IT Developer/Data Scientist
description:
**Start****17-08-2024****Duration****4-6 months**
  
We are seeking an IT Data Developer / Analyst with excellent analytical skills and experience from the financial sector, preferably from payment, financial crime and/or transaction monitoring systems (AML). The person will work in a Nordic based project in the bank and some travelling must be considered.  

  

Scope and type of initiative:  

Multiple initiatives within a Programme scoped with the enhancement of the Cross-Border Transaction Monitoring capability.  

  

What he /she will be doing:  

Conducting the full range of data development and analytical activities. Working within a Programme Test Team.

  

Required Technical Skills / competencies:  

* Working experience within the areas of payment, financial crime and/or transaction monitoring systems (AML).
* Proven knowledge of at least two of the following: Python, SQL, DAX, Excel/VBA, R, Scala, C#, Tableau or any other programming language and/or visualization tools used for data analysis.
* Proven knowledge of Python, Scala, Spark experience - it's a must have
* Understanding of the technical requirements for building entity resolution solutions.
* Understanding of the financial payment flows and financial transactional data in a bank.
* Understanding of working with risk and compliance cases when conducting analysis.
* Data modelling experience using data modelling tools like Power Designer / CA ERwin / IBM InfoSphere Data Architect / Python / SQL.
* Optimize and update logical and physical data models to support new and existing projects.
* Implement data strategies, build data flows and develop conceptual data models in collaboration with data stewards
* Perform reverse engineering of physical data models from databases and scripts.
* Ability to analyze data-related system integration challenges and propose appropriate solutions.
* Understand and translate business needs into technical long-term solutions.
* Expertise in capturing and documenting business requirements and converting these into the foundation for IT design and development
* Ability to analyze provided data and present the findings / results to PM and business stakeholders

  

Preferable skills /competencies:  

* Understanding of Payment systems technical architecture.
* Ability to independently carry out and drive technical workshop / activities.
* Adapts interpersonal style to suit different people or situations.
* Hands-on database design and modelling experience within single and multi-platform environments.
* Experience with Quantexa or similar network analysis tools
* Analytical experience with structured vs. unstructured customer transactional data .
* Deep understanding of the content and structure of SEPA and Swift cross border messages, both MT and MX (ISO 20022)
* Backend system validation experience and understanding any dependencies and impacts.
* Possible experience with external lookup and verification of government owned company and address data.
* Clarify, document and communicate the functional and non-functional requirements by using data, process or information modelling and drive delivery of a change initiative in alignment with the target picture to enable sustainable solutions.
* Understand the structure, dynamics, terminology and IT applications of the payment systems and work closely with stakeholders in business, IT and external partners.
* Experience working with correspondent banking related projects

  

Other skills / competencies:  

* Excellent oral English skills and ability to drive a technical meeting in English
* Excellent English writing skills and ability to produce precise and relevant written material
* Being able to facilitate a technical physical or remote Teams meeting with the focus on getting a common understanding and provide results
* Being able to explain and report technical complexity in a less technical language
* Managing technical stakeholders to deliver expected results
* Making a close corporation with the Project Manager driving the project with common stakeholders
* Agile way of working Knowledge and Application
* Deals with ambiguity, making positive uses of the opportunities it presents

  

Technology:  

Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark , Python, Scala, Spark, SQL, DAX, Excel/VBA, R, Scala, C#, Tableau or any other programming language and/or visualization tools used for data analysis. Data modelling experience using data modelling tools like Power Designer / CA ERwin / IBM InfoSphere Data Architect / Python / SQL.  

Location: Stockholm

title: Fullstack Developer - Strategic Product Development
description:
**Sambla Group is a fast-growing fintech company with the clear goal of empowering customers to improve their personal finances and provide them with the best consumer finance products in the industry. Backed by a winning mindset and over 350 colleagues in 4 countries, we have successfully helped more than 1 million customers improve their financial situation by consolidating their personal loans and helping them seek better terms.**  

  

We are looking for a skilled and well-rounded Full-Stack Developer with a stronger emphasis on backend development, who is curious about learning new technologies, comfortable researching and implementing sound and scalable technological choices and solutions, and vocal in brainstorming sessions to effectively contribute to the best possible outcome.  

  

We need you, your ambition and your skills to join us in an exciting opportunity to work with a new fast-paced strategic initiative at Sambla Group. You will be joining a team of experts, building a customer-facing product at an early stage of development and making a strong impact on the product and customer experience.  

  

Our primary programming languages are JavaScript and TypeScript, with Node.js and Express powering our backend, and React (JS/TS) for our frontend framework.


Our main stack consists of microservices that leverage an event-driven architecture, supported by a fully Dockerized local development environment and AWS CloudFormation for infrastructure.

 **Amongst other things, you will work with:**

* Collaborate with a cross-functional team to design, develop, and implement the platform for the new product.
* Participate in all phases of the product development lifecycle, from concept to deployment.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code.
* Troubleshoot, test, and maintain the platform to ensure good product fit and technical excellence.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of the product by actively seeking feedback and providing innovative solutions.
* Engage in highly mission driven sessions on a daily basis to facilitate rapid development cycles in a Skunk Works setting.
  

  

**Requirements:**

* Proven track record as a developer with a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience, preferably with full stack responsibility and high shipping frequency
* Relevant Computer Science or Engineering Education at least at BA level.
* Solid understanding of software development principles and methodologies
* Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  

  

**A bit of extra credit:**  

We value experience or familiarity with our chosen technologies such as Node.js, React, Docker, AWS and microservice architecture, but for the right candidate who has shown curiosity in different technologies and architectures, we will provide the necessary learning environment to quickly get up to speed with our stack and ways of working.

  


**What we offer:**

* Work directly with a senior developer with extensive domain knowledge, gaining valuable insights and mentorship.
* Be part of a highly motivated and innovative team dedicated to creating the next product offering for Sambla Group.
* Opportunity to make a significant impact on the development and success of a new product.
* Engage in a Skunk Works style setting where we do things together to foster creativity, collaboration, and rapid problem-solving.  

  

Please note!  

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

title: Forest Planning & Optimisation Developer
description:
**Job ID:** R0008104


**Date posted:** 26/07/2024


**Company description** **Are you a highly motivated self-starter and strong team player?** Are you a forward-thinking forest and wood supply professional seeking a role that combines your expertise with a passion for build a better future for generations to come?


Look no further! We have an exceptional opportunity for you to **join our team at Inter IKEA Forest Investments** and play a vital role to strengthening IKEA's position as an affordable home furnishing retailer by securing a strategic share of IKEA future wood fiber needs through own Inter IKEA investments in forestlands.


Help us to shape the future of IKEA making a lasting impact on the future of home furnishing while contributing to a more sustainable world. Apply now and unleash your potential with a globally recognized brand that values collaboration, innovation, and responsible investment practices.  



  

**Job description** **JOB DESCRIPTION – HOW?**


Forest planning and optimization developer play a critical role in the growth and strategic development of Inter IKEA development of the forest asset portfolio. The work supports the strategic planning, financial analysis, negotiation, and operational management, by developing and using complex models to assess the value of forest lands, timber resources, and related assets. All aimed at ensuring successful and sustainable mergers and acquisitions.

**Be more specific on the assignments:**

* Data Collection and Preparation, collect relevant data for the forest area, including topography, soil type, climate data, and current forest inventory.
* GIS (Geographic Information System) and Remote Sensing Analysis, Use GIS, and remote sensing technologies to analyze the spatial characteristics of the forest area.
* Development of Growth and Yield Model: Develop a forest growth and yield model using appropriate software (e.g., R, Python, or specialized forestry modeling software). including financial analysis.
* Scenario Analysis Use the developed model to run various management scenarios, such as different harvesting regimes, reforestation plans, return requirements and climate change impacts.
* Risk Assessment: Conduct a risk assessment based on the model’s projections, identifying potential risks to forest health and productivity...
* Stakeholder Communication, prepare communication materials to present the model’s findings and recommendations to stakeholders, including forest managers, conservation organizations, and policymakers.
* Integration with Management Plans, Integrate the model’s results into existing forest management plans, suggesting modifications based on the model’s projections.
* Documentation and Reporting, document all steps of the modeling process, including data sources,

  

**Qualification** **QUALIFICATIONS – WHO?**

**We are looking for you who seek for opportunities to fuel your passion for business, people, and planet.** As you contribute to increasing customer value, driving business growth, and achieving remarkable results through the power of collaboration. With a mindset that constantly seeks better ways, you'll play a pivotal role in a business that leads the industry in creating a better everyday life for the many people.


Embrace the challenge of making a significant impact on how we conduct business within the limits of the planet, fueled by your high level of integrity, commitment to high standards, and deep interest in global market and industry developments.


As a self-starter with a sense of urgency and positive energy, you'll unleash your potential, delivering outstanding outcomes while embracing every challenge as an opportunity for growth. Join us and be part of a remarkable journey where your actions will shape a brighter future for all.

**To succeed in this role, you have:**

* Educational Background, Degree in Forestry or Related Field: bachelor’s or master’s degree in forestry, Forest Management, Environmental Science, Economics, or a related field.
* Advanced Quantitative Skills: Coursework or degrees in quantitative fields such as statistics, mathematics, or financial modeling.
* Industry Knowledge, Forest Management Practices: Comprehensive understanding of sustainable forest management, silviculture, timber harvesting, and conservation. Knowledge of environmental laws and regulations affecting forestry.
* Technical Skills, Expertise in various valuation methods such as discounted cash flow (DCF), comparable sales, and cost approaches specific to forestry. Proficiency in developing complex financial models to project future cash flows, investment returns, and risk assessments.
* Sensing: Skills in using Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and remote sensing technologies for spatial analysis and forest inventory assessments.
* Statistical Analysis: Strong abilities in statistical analysis, data manipulation, and interpretation using software such as R, Python, SAS, or SPSS.
* Analytical and Quantitative Skills Ability to analyze large datasets related to forest inventories, market trends, and environmental impacts.
* Project Management, Project Planning: Ability to plan, coordinate, and execute valuation modeling projects from initiation to completion.
* Communication Skills, Proficiency in preparing detailed valuation reports, including model assumptions, methodologies, results, and recommendations. Engagement: Effective communication skills to present findings and recommendations to clients, investors, and other stakeholders.

  

**More Information**  

If you have any questions about the role please contact Tobias Svensson, Forest Acquisition Manager at tobias.svensson@inter.ikea.com


We are looking forward to your application! **Please submit both your CV and motivational letter in English by August 16th 2024.** We are reviewing applications as they come through so don’t wait to apply!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: SAS coding Developer
description:
**Start****04-08-2024****Duration****4-6 months**
  
For one of our clients, we are looking for SAS Developer.  

  

It is for a project to update calculation engine, removing fixed time horizon.  

  

**Detailed description of work task to be carried out**  

-Update current calculation engine programmed in SAS Basis. Currently the engine projects credit risk metrics on a fixed time horizon of three years - this should be removed so that any time horizon is possible, in particular up to 10 years.  

* Change management and documentation of the model change, including production of documentation for review by independent model validation
* Project description and project plan with status update to managers
* Testing of solution and analysis of testing, including dry run to ensure replication of results in the new version
 **Description of knowledge and experience**

* Strong coding in SAS
* Formal training eg from SAS institute is advantageous
* Experience from similar projects advantageous
* Experience from documentation to meet validation requirements
* Ability to understand the change requirements

  

The change must be operational including testing by 30 September**Start:**  

05.08.2024

 **Duration:**  

4-6months

 **Work load:**  

Full time

 **Location:**  

Location can be in Copenhagen or Oslo, or in Stockholm, Helsinki.

title: Fullstackutvecklare
description:
Konsulterna ska förstärka ett av Organisation utvecklingsteam som fullstack utvecklare och förvalta och utveckla Organisation tjänster. Konsulten ska kunna röra sig mellan backend och frontend tekniker och navigerar testdriven utveckling och testautomation.
  
  

**Uppdraget kan bestå bland annat av följande uppgifter:**  

* Ta fram och utveckla lösningsförslag.
* Dokumentera lösningar, gränssnitt mm.
* Testa funktioner och tjänster.
* Implementera och exekvera automatiska tester.


Uppdraget kan förändras där till exempel konsulten kan komma att ingå i andra projekt och eller förvaltning, i rollen som systemutvecklare.
  
För detta uppdrag söker organisationen fullstack utvecklare och därav utgår organisationen ifrån att konsulten har såväl spetskompetens inom vissa områden och bred kompetens inom andra. Organisationen önskar därför att det tydligt framgår i svarsrutan nedan vilken spetskompetens och vilken bred kompetens offererad konsult har.
  
Konsulten ska vara tillgänglig för intervju. Intervjuerna kommer ske på distans via virtuellt mötesrum och offererade konsulter ska vara tillgängliga för intervju 13–15 augusti mellan 08:00 - 18:00. Kallelse till intervju kan komma med kort varsel och intervjun förväntas ta cirka 30 minuter i anspråk. Då organisationen efterfrågar många konsulter i detta avrop kommer det vara ytterst begränsat med möjlighet att välja tid för intervju.
  
  

Ska-krav
  
* Kompetensnivå 3 (4–8 år).
* Konsulten ska kunna påbörja uppdraget 2024-09-02.
* Ange referenspersons namn, e-post och telefonnummer.
* Offererad konsult ska ha


minst fem (5) års erfarenhet av arbete som senior utvecklare inom
  
minst två (2) av följande tekniker.
  
Minst tre (3) år av arbetslivserfarenheter ska vara förvärvad någon gång under den senaste femårsperioden:
  
  

* Offererad konsult bör ha...
* mins ett (1) års erfarenhet av arbete REST-baserade tjänster. Arbetslivserfarenheten ska vara förvärvad någon gång under den senaste treårsperioden.
* Offererad konsult bör ha erfarenhet av containerbaserade tekniker som Docker, Kubernetes och OpenShift.
* Offererad konsult bör ha erfarenhet av utveckling i Linux-miljö.
* Offererad konsult bör ha arbetat med versionshantering exempelvis GIT.
* Offererad konsult bör ha arbetat med enhetstestning och/eller TDD.
* Offererad konsult bör ha erfarenhet av utvecklingsverktyget IntelliJ.
* Offererad konsult bör ha erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med testverktyget ReadyAPI.
* Offererad konsult bör ha erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med testverktyget Cypress.
* Offererad konsult bör ha erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med kontinuerlig testning av pipelines/CI/CD.


Beskriv kortfattat på vilket sätt offererad konsult uppfyller ovanstående krav. Ange information om arbets-/uppdragsgivare, uppdragets innehåll och tidpunkt samt omfattning i antal månader.
  
**Location:** Stockholm
  
**Competence area:** Full stack Developer
  
**Start date:** 2024-09-02

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
**Position Type**
 Full time
   

  

**Type Of Hire**
 Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)
   

  

**Education Desired**
 Bachelor of Computer Science
   

  

**Travel Percentage**
 0%
   

  

**Junior Software Engineer**
**Location~ Stockholm, Sweden**
 FIS is a leading global provider of financial software that powers the world's economy. We are a diverse team of innovators who are passionate about creating cutting-edge fintech products and solutions for our clients and communities. We are committed to championing diversity and creating an inclusive workplace.
   

  

 The FIS Cross-Asset Trading and Risk Platform (formerly Front Arena) helps firms quickly enter new markets and support new strategies. We deliver real-time controls for trading, order management, profit & loss and position keeping with risk management, all on one platform for both sell-side and buy-side.
   

  

 Your role As a Junior Software Engineer in the Workflow team, you will be challenged with a wide range of tasks. You will be involved in the design, development, and maintenance of PRIME – a client application within the FIS Cross-Asset Trading and Risk Platform. The Workflow team is responsible for the development of trade entry frameworks and applications, workflows for life-cycle events and back-office operations. The development is typically done using C++, Python, and other native techniques.
   

  

 We believe you are a Software Engineer with some experience in developing software in C or C++ (or equivalent). You are keen on taking responsibility for your own development. Your responsibilities will, besides development, include automated testing, support assistance and maintenance.
   

  

 We will offer you stimulating challenges, where understanding customer requirements and solving problems is a key part, in combination with creating advanced technical solutions. You will be part of an agile team with skilled and motivated developers and QA that take full responsibility for its solution which includes both working on continuous improvements as well as innovations. We believe that the best solutions are built by those who are proud of what they produce! By working closely together with Senior Developers and the Product Owner in your Scrum team you will get a deep understanding of market needs and software design. Position requirements
   

  

 We strongly believe that passion for financial markets and software development are equally necessary! We know that we can accomplish a lot more together than as individuals so are you a creative, passionate and a caring team player?
   

  

**We Expect You To Have The Following**
* Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering Physics, or similar degree
* 0-3 years of experience in system development
* Understanding of Object-Oriented Programming
* Experience with C/C++ and Python is an advantage
* Knowledge and interest in financial mathematics
* Have capacity to deliver high quality software in a high pace environment
* Fluent English


**In Addition To This We Believe That You**
* Like to take initiatives and influence the direction of your own development
* Have strong analytical thinking with an attitude that problems are to be solved
* Are communicative and strongly like to work in a team and share knowledge with others
* Are not afraid of challenging your colleagues in their mindset
* Have interest/experience in agile methodologies and software test automation


**What we offer you At FIS,** 
 we offer you the opportunity to shape the future of fintech. You will be part of an expansive phase
   

  

 In Our Continued Journey. We Believe In Creating a Workplace Where Ideas Can Flow Freely And Where Every Day Is Different. A Career At FIS Is More Than Just a Job. We Offer
   

  

* A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
* The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services and technology
* A voice in the future of one of the World's largest Fintech organizations
* An informal and inclusive culture where we 'Win as a team' and care for each other
* A flexible work-life where we embrace the mix of working digitally and from the office
* Competitive salary and benefits package


**Privacy Statement**
 FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice .
   

  

**Sourcing Model**
 Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.
   

  

 #pridepass

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.
   

  

**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 350+ amazing people who work here.**
**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
 We are seeking a skilled Full-Stack Developer with emphasis on backend development to join our dynamic Self-Service team. This role focuses on maintaining and enhancing our customer journey, a key part of our customer-facing product.
   

  

 Our primary language is JavaScript/TypeScript using NodeJS Express as our backend and React(JS/TS) as a frontend framework. We don’t expect you to be proficient on our stack, experience with other languages is welcome!
   

  

**Amongst Other Things, You Will Work With**
* Maintain and develop our customer journey application.
* Collaborate on diverse projects, taking on various tasks and responsibilities within different codebases.
* Communicate rapidly and effectively within the team and across departments, including product, design, and data teams.
* Participate in daily code reviews to ensure high-quality code and continuous improvement.
* Work within an Agile inspired methodology, utilizing sprints, epics, and detailed ticket breakdowns.
* Value and incorporate team opinions regardless of seniority, fostering a collaborative environment.


**Must Have**
* Minimum of 3 years of working experience as a developer.
* Proficiency in English, both verbal and written.
* Strong communication skills and curiosity.
* Problem-solving mindset, both individually and collaboratively.
* Passion for sharing knowledge and ideas.


**A Bit Of Extra Credit If You Also Have**
* Experience with Node.js.
* Experience with React.
* Backend development expertise.
* Docker experience.
* SQL knowledge.
* Experience with microservice architecture.
* Experience with AWS.
* Experience from the Fintech industry.


**What We Offer**
* A benefits package that includes health-related benefits, pension plans, paid time off, and additional perks designed to support your overall well-being and professional growth.
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

title: Backend developer
description:
We are looking for senior backend engineers to join us and expand our team of talented backend developers. You share a passion for building systems that delivers high business value without sacrificing maintainability, availability, scalability and quality. You will work on the backend systems that power our casino platform and help us deliver the best customer experience.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and help operate our systems
* Drive technical improvements throughout the stack
* Together with product teams deliver the best games and business solutions
* Help scale our solution to customer requirements and business opportunities


 Who you are
   

  

* You have 5+ years of experience working in a mixed Java, SQL, Javascript environment
* Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
* You are passionate about working in an environment of continuous learning
* You are curious, driven and not afraid to take charge and improve the system and add automation where needed
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in
* You have experience from working on large Java systems and have a solid understanding of performance, scalability and availability challenges of distributed systems
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* You know your way around a modern Unix/Linux system
* Experience with modern deployment, monitoring and logging solutions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Senior Dotnet Developer
description:
Are you excited about finding ways to make code more efficient and less costly?
 



  





 Join us at Instabridge. Our vision is a
 *free global internet* 
 .
 



  





 We have apps that make it possible for people to get online, no matter their current income.
 



  





 What’s our traction like?
 


* We have 10 million monthly active users.
* We are profitable.



  





 Who are our users?
 



 Our users are all over the world. The common factor is that they want to save money on their internet connection.
 



  





 Some use Instabridge when they are traveling, to avoid finding a new telco provider in their destination. Others use Instabridge because they only have limited data on their phone today.
 



  





 Where are we heading?
 



 We have a lot of traction on our apps, and are looking for someone that wants to be part of our journey.
 



  





 Your role would be focused on back-end development in dotnet. More specifically, we are looking for someone who can initiate lots of projects that make our existing code more efficient and cheaper to run on our cloud providers.
 



  





 This mean you will find improvement projects for in our current architecture and infrastructure. You will also initiate development projects that realizes the improvement opportunities.
 



  





 Skills and Requirements
 



 To succeed in the role you need to:
 


* Have experience with dotnet development on AWS and/or GCP
* Further experience with AWS API Gateway, AWS Elastic Beanstalk, AWS Lambda, PostgreSQL
* Have an interest to work on making infra more efficient and cheaper



  





 Some other things we would love for you to have experience with:
 


* AWS EC2
* AWS CloudWatch
* AWS RDS
* Heroku
* Cloudflare
* AWS ElastiCache
* AWS VPC
* Performance and system monitoring-tools like NewRelic, Datalog etc.



  





 Why Instabridge?
 



 At Instabridge, you will give free internet to the world. Something that democratize internet for real. You will also be part of one of the fastest-growing startups in Sweden right now.
 



  





 Apply today
 



 We are actively recruiting for this role. We will reach out to you at the latest 2 days after your application.
 



  





 Please apply today by clicking "Easy Apply".

* Experience of using Xcode - SwiftUi.

* An ability to easily communicate and work with others in teams, both with colleagues and customers.

**This is a unpaid internship initially**

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Want to drive digital change in automotive?**
 At Volvo Cars, we are making bold digital visions come true. We aim to lead in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making our customers' lives less complicated. Now we are looking for curious, creative people who want to change the world through innovative thinking.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a developer in our team you will build microservices to support our communications platform primarily using REST APIs. You will work with the discovery and delivery in an empowered product team. This will include rapid development of prototypes/concepts as well as regular product development to push development at Volvo Cars to the next level.You'll design and build applications based in Java and Kotlin and ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications. We deploy our applications in Kubernetes, our CI/CD is based on GitHub actions, ArgoCD and use tools like GitHub, Jager, EFK, Graphana among others. The applications interact with different queue and databases like Kafka, Artemis, REDIS, PostgreSQL just to name a few.You'll collaborate with other engineers in a cross-functional team (working on Android, iOS, quality and backend), Product, and UX to define, design, and ship new features as well as fix bugs and help maintain code quality, organisation, and automation.
   

  

 What you’ll bring:
   

  

 We believe that you have a profound experience in backend development, with a particular focus on Java and knowledge in C# since we are porting old technologies from C# to our new platform. Comfort in working within an information platform environment that is enhanced with Docker, Kubernetes, and Cloud technologies. Knowledge in Azure DevOps is required since we are migrating all our applications to Azure from AWS. A deep understanding of microservices architecture and Graph Federation. Proficiency in database technologies, including both SQL and NoSQL systems, is a must. Front-end development skills are considered a bonus.
   

  

 To be effective in this role you need to take charge as well as be a collaborator. You should have the ability to drive and create commitment. It is important that you have integrity and a change management mindset.
   

  

 How to learn more and apply:
   

  

 We are continuously screening applications and will fill the position as soon as we find a good match, please submit your application. For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Senior Technical Recruiter Sara Zinad at: sara.zinad@volvocars.com. Please note that applications via email will not be accepted due to GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation).
   

  

**Who are we?**
 Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.
   

  

 Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Server Reliability - World of Warcraft | Europe
description:
**Team Name**
 World of Warcraft
   

  

**Job Title**
 Senior Software Engineer, Server Reliability - World of Warcraft | Europe
   

  

**Requisition ID**
 R022812
   

  

**Job Description**
 The World of Warcraft team is seeking an engineer to join the Server Reliability team. In this role, you will work with engineers and designers to enable hosting new and exciting content.
   

  

 As a server reliability engineer, we’ll need you to investigate any service issues that occur, partnering closely with designers and engineers to push new content and deploy fixes. You’ll find yourself digging into source code, reviewing changes looking for hidden complexities, tracking evidence in logs and server telemetry, and using your eye for reliability to help the team make great decisions. If you are someone who loves solving technical service issues, we’d love to see your application.
   

  

 Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer competitive benefits and strive for a healthy work / life balance. We work hard to foster a deeply collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything, and we are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences… ever. Join us!
   

  

 What you will do…
   

  

* Create, and support the build systems and automation for World of Warcraft.
* Deploy data hotfixes to databases throughout the development lifecycle.
* Review, build, and deploy server software in a live environment.
* Diagnose software problems occurring within the World of Warcraft servers.
* Promote, contribute to, and participate in our culture of inclusion and diversity


 To succeed, you must have…
   

  

* The ability to use deductive reasoning to solve problems
* 5+ Years of Software Development Experience
* Proficiency with C++
* A tenacious curiosity for diagnosing exactly why something went wrong
* A reliability geared mindset, to be able to look at the architecture of a system and help predict how changes might impact customers and infrastructure
* Familiarity with Networking and Server Design concepts
* Fluency in an object-oriented programming language
* Strong communication skills


 We’re also interested in hearing stories you may have about…
   

  

* Working with Linux and/or Databases
* Used automation to help reduce toil and/or increase development velocity.
* Needing to solve problems that were tricky and technical


 We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Accommodation Request: We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com. General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.
   

  

 Our World
   

  

 At Blizzard Entertainment, we pour our hearts and souls into everything we create. Best known for iconic video game universes including Warcraft, Overwatch, Diablo, and StarCraft, we’ve been creating genre-defining games for millions of players around the world for more than 30 years. We’re on a quest: bring our dreams to life and craft the most epic entertainment experiences…ever. Hard work, iteration and polish go into the Blizzard “secret recipe,” but the most important ingredients come from talented people who share our vision. If that sounds like you, join us.
   

  

 The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, among other characteristics.

title: Senior iOS Developer
description:
**Description**
**About the Team**
 We at Accedo are passionate about technology and building fantastic software products. We are experts and leaders in the realm of video streaming. It’s no coincidence that some of our customers are giants like Netflix, Spotify, BBC, HBO and Deutsche Telekom, just to name a few. Our mission is to innovate continuously and to disrupt the industry by creating a scalable platform for building impactful video applications. Accedo One , our award-winning produc t is a testament to Accedo’s expertise and leadership worldwide.
   

  

 Our flagship product, Accedo One, is the SaaS user experience platform designed to launch, adapt, and grow video services. With integrations with renowned vendors in the video industry, it facilitates applications on major platforms and a management system that brands, configures, and curates intuitively, reducing development and operational costs for customers.
   

  

 To continue to excel, we are growing our team with multiple openings! We’re looking for a Senior iOS Engineer to join our team in
 **Stockholm** 
 . You will join an international engineering team and will collaborate with the rest of our teams - QA, Design, Product management, etc.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Competitive salary and benefits
* Private health insurance
* Yearly training budget - which can be spent on IT conferences or online trainings
* Nice, spacious office in the hip area of Södermalm
* Flexible home office options (past Covid-19 too!)
* Opportunity to participate in Hackathons and a range of company events


**What You Will Do**
* Maintain a scalable and extensible, modular iOS and tvOS application
* Collaborate with the cross-disciplined product team to build a high quality user experience
* Take part in architectural decisions and strive to constantly improve the existing codebase
* Review other team members code
* Ship efficient, reliable, crash-free code in Swift that reaches millions of users


**What We Are Looking For**
* Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or related discipline
* 4+ years of experience in building iOS apps using Swift Objective-C
* Ability to develop against a variety of remote services and systems (HTTP, JSON, REST, etc.)
* Experience in Reactive and functional programming
* Experience and knowledge of design and architectural patterns, such as MVVM, MVP, VIP
* Excellent command of English


**Other Highly Desirable Skills**
* Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or related discipline
* Experience in building iOS apps using Objective-C
* Good understanding of development methodologies, testing practices, and tools and knowing when to apply each method
* Experience in technologies such as SwiftUI and Combine
* Strong communication skills and knowing when to ask for help and bounce ideas and solutions off peers
* Experience in video and media-based development projects (DRM, OVPs, Advertising, Analytics)
* Experience with Jenkins and Fastlane

title: Senior Engineering Manager (Trading)
description:
*We are Tibber, the energy company that wants you to use less energy. Whaaat? That’s right. We’ll get back to that. Yes, we are by definition an energy company, but we’re more techy than most. How and why you might ask? Well, a third of our employees are actually working on developing products and solutions that can help you use energy in a smarter way and at a lower cost – all with the help of cool fancy tech. Good for our customers, their wallets, and the planet.*
*Our growth rate has been truly amazing, and still, we’re just getting started. With millions of smart devices connected to the Tibber platform (like electric vehicles and smart thermostats), we have one of the most unique portfolios trading energy on the market* 
 .
   

  

 Hear This Brand New Podcast With Our Head Of Trading Jacob Dalton On Some Of The Latest And Greatest Projects Tibber Are Working On
   

  

**Job Mission 🚀🚀**
 We are now looking for a passionate and experienced Senior Engineering Manager to help us on our continued journey and growth within House of Engineering and specifically our Trading Product Area. As a Senior Engineering Manager at Tibber, you will inspire, be the manager of and apply leadership to the Engineers and engineering efforts in your Product Area. Within this area you will be part of the Product Area Leadership where you will be a partner in crime with your Product Area Lead counterpart. In this role you will balance business and product impact with accountability for sustained technical innovation and delivery as well as keeping the lights on of the technology ownership of the area.
   

  

 Tibber is on a mission to create Europe’s largest consumer Virtual Power Plant. As Senior Engineering Manager for Trading, you will lead the engineering team that builds the growth engine to propel us across Europe. You will work on technology that is at the heart of pulling off a magic trick so powerful that it moves energy through time. The engineering effort to pull this off includes both power trading and flexibility trading and requires a wide range of technologies including building portfolio optimisation and algorithmic trading infrastructure that seamlessly integrate with the larger HEMS orchestration through Orleans actor model infrastructure.
   

  

 Our Product Areas consist of development teams called squads, and in this Product Area, you will work with two squads both on Power Trading as well as Flexibility Trading. You’ll also work with Tibber's engineering systems and the bigger engineering team as well as your engineering leadership to build high-performing development teams that find alignment on Product Area priorities so that we can reach higher levels of autonomy and ultimately speed.
   

  

**This is you!**
**Relevant industry experience** 
 . Ideally you have proven experience working within the power trading industry. Having a focus around flexibility, and specifically of distributed energy resources, is a big plus.
   

  

**Lead, drive, and facilitate complex technical delivery.** 
 This is within the Product Area whether it's architectural alignment with Staff Engineers and Senior Engineers or coordinating and leading technical projects from start to finish that span across Product Areas.
   

  

**You thrive when coaching, mentoring, and growing great people** 
 ,
 **not just great tech and products.** 
 You do this with a big grain of humbleness and respect for each individual’s growth and competency. You find yourself easily building rapport and trust with the people around you.
   

  

**You have a proven track record of applying pragmatism to reaching your targets.** 
 You also follow this up with a solid leadership style that takes accountability for the long-term and strategic success of your team’s technology and the value it provides to our customers.
   

  

**The developer experience is close to your heart** 
 . You care for solid software practices and conscious experimentation letting data guide your decisions. You are an active part of the stand-ups of your teams and are not afraid to lead within the rituals of the teams.
   

  

**You have a strong engineering background.** 
 This allows you to quickly understand developer toils and challenges so that you can stay to the point and take correct action when needed. This also helps you in team discussions when trade-offs to solutions need decisions to move forward.
   

  

**Ideally you can ⚡️⚡️**
**Inspire with your leadership.** 
 As your Product Area grows you will lead engineering managers with teams of their own as well as build and lead groups of engineers directly reporting to you through hiring, coaching, mentoring, feedback and hands-on career development. Tibber is in constant change and growth and this requires dynamic and pragmatic leadership.
   

  

**Mission achieve.** 
 Be a partner-in-crime with the Trading Product Area Lead by driving the technical delivery and strategy to your reaching your mission.
   

  

**Naturally facilitate.** 
 Facilitate collaboration with other engineers, data analysts, product managers and designers for solutions getting us closer to our mission.
   

  

**Foster and nurture the team and it’s culture.** 
 Build and cultivate a healthy, transparent and open engineering culture that's inclusive and really really fun to work in.
   

  

**Grow and develop your team.** 
 Evangelize engineering best practices and grow the technical skills of the team.
   

  

**🦹🏽‍♀️👨‍🎤Get Ready For**
**Innovation.** 
 A way to change the landscape of one of the most important industries on the planet.
   

  

**Growth.** 
 A possibility to learn a lot and push the barriers of what you think is possible, with the possibility to grow personally and professionally.
   

  

**Autonomy.** 
 An autonomous and humble culture in a scale-up adventure.
   

  

**Empowerment.** 
 Your voice matters, we are a place to work where laughter and support amongst diverse and inclusive colleagues are guaranteed.
   

  

**Flexibility.** 
 Whether this is towards health, wellness, equipment, or other allowances important to you, we will do our best to accommodate your needs. Many of us are parents and we all value a good work-life balance.
   

  

**💆🏻‍♀️💆🏽‍♂️The Tibber Mindset**
 Being on a mission to change an industry as we do fundamentally also means being prepared for the unexpected. Tibber is a startup in the word's true sense, which means we are on a journey of constant change. We do what others say can’t be done, try and fail together but never lose sight of our users.
   

  

 We work passionately with sustainability and a circular approach, both with our products and in the entire ecosystem that is affected by everything we do.
   

  

 We're very proud of being a mission-driven startup with thousands and thousands of new users every month. Starting out with two passionate founders in 2016, we're now 300+ people working for Tibber in our offices in Stockholm, Førde, Berlin, Amsterdam, Oslo, and Helsinki, and with that number growing each week, we’re still just getting started. Through 2024 we will continue to grow within our markets, and we are thrilled to be backed by investors like Balderton Capital, Eight Roads Ventures, Founders Fund, Summa, and Schibsted.
   

  

*At Tibber, we are committed to hiring, developing, and retaining exceptional people regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, or gender identity. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply.*
 Tibber is a different company in a very traditional industry. We are aiming to create the best digital tool so that you as a user can apply new technologies to reduce energy consumption and power costs.

title: Aspiring Dealmaker
description:
*Primrock is seeking a Junior Business Developer with a talent for dealmaking and B2B-transactions which can shape the future electricity market.* 




  





**About Primrock** 




 Primrock provides capacity and balance services to the Nordic electricity market. We are a fast-growing and customer-focused company on the edge of the evolving power system in Sweden. We strive to facilitate the transition to a 100% renewable power system.
 



**Tasks** 




 As Primrock’s junior business developer you will participate in the development and growth of our unique and innovative B2B offerings to end-users of electricity in Sweden. Initially you will support the senior members of the business development team. Over time you will grow into presentations and negotiations and, subsequently, into the development of new services and commercial projects.
 



**Your Profile** 




 You have a university degree in Economics, Engineering or Management from a top university. You have a strong motivation for profitable and scalable development. You like to work hard to achieve extraordinary results. Proficiency in Swedish is a requirement. Interest in and knowledge about energy systems and markets is a plus.
 



**Benefits** 




 A great startup experience. Competitive salary and compensation.
 



**About the job** 




 The position is full time (100%). Primrock offers a competitive compensation package. Our office is located in Stockholm. The position will start in September 2024.
 



**Apply** 




 We evaluate applications continuously. Deadline for applications is 18:00 pm (CET) on Wednesday 31 July 2024. We look forward to your application!

title: Lead Software Engineer – Back End (FinTech) (Bangkok based – Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know Our Team**
 Fintech is one of the fastest growing areas in Agoda and we are rapidly expanding our tech team. We work closely with the finance business team and our Fintech product owners to reduce risk, drive efficiencies and move on new market opportunities in this exciting field. We have a wide range of projects from traditional finance to cutting-edge customer fintech. For example, reconciliation using Big Data technologies, growing and optimizing customer payments options, tax calculations in milli-second response times and a mesh of supplier payment options like virtual credit cards. It ’ s a hot field and the perfect mix of data engineering and backend engineering.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
**In this role, you will not only develop robust backend systems but also architect and maintain scalable data pipelines and storage solutions that support complex data collection, processing, and analysis. Your dual expertise in backend and data engineering will play a crucial role in optimizing our financial technology solutions and driving informed business decisions through reliable data insights.**
**In This Role, You’ll Get to**
* Think and own the full life cycle of our products, not just a single piece of code – from business requirements, technology selection, coding standards, agile development, unit and application testing, to CI/CD and proper monitoring
* Design, develop and maintain platforms and data pipelines across fintech
* Boost System Performance: build systems that are stable, scalable, and highly performant to meet the dynamic demands of the financial landscape
* Write great code and help others write great code – mentor people in your team and wider
* Collaborate with other teams and departments
* Exceptional problem-solving skills coupled with a strategic mindset are essential. You possess the ability to adapt to new changes and the foresight to anticipate future needs. Leadership at Agoda isn’t just managing tasks but inspiring innovation and driving vision into reality.
* Foster Cross-Functional Collaboration: work with diverse teams to drive forward product and technology goals
* Shape our future team: Play a pivotal role in recruiting and onboarding exceptional talent


**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* 10+ years of experience with strong proficiency in Java, Kotlin, Scala, or C# with a proven track record of developing high-performance applications in production settings. Insightful experience with big data technologies like Hadoop, real-time processing frameworks (e.g., Apache Spark), and advanced knowledge of SQL and data architecture.
* Thinks in systems: their edge cases, failure modes, and life cycles
* Uses a metrics driven approach and can make informed decisions using data
* You are passionate about the craft of software development and constantly work to improve your knowledge and skills
* Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies
* Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
* Experience with operational excellence and a deep understanding of metrics, alarms and dashboards


**It’s Great If You Have**
* Experience working in a modern FinTech or Payments organization
* Domain knowledge in any of these areas: financial reconciliation, financial reporting, tax, payout methods like virtual credit cards or customer payments
* Hands-on experience working with technologies like Spark for data processing, ETLs for data pipelines and queueing systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).
* Core engineering infrastructure tools like GitLab for source control and Continuous Integration, Kubernetes
* Experience developing, maintaining and debugging large-scale distributed systems
* Experience in leading projects, initiatives and/or teams, with full ownership of the systems involved
