title: Fullstack engineer with frontend expertise
description:
This is Mevisio
   

  

*Mevisio is a fast-growing scale-up offering a low-code platform that digitizes management and collaboration in the manufacturing industry.*
 We provide a digital alternative to the physical whiteboards traditionally used for daily team meetings on the shop floor, with applications extending to general operations management and other Lean Manufacturing practices. The Mevisio Platform is a tool for leaders and team members to help them work smarter and more efficiently with the help of visualization and improved communication. Mevisio is highly customizable to the specific requirements of each client, including layout of boards and integrations with other systems, that allows the platform to solve the different needs of each company.
   

  

 Our main clientele comprises large enterprise industries, globally operating companies, and we've expanded our user base to over 50 countries in just a couple of years and there is much more to come!
   

  

*We are revolutionizing the way manufacturing industries operate. Sounds cool, right?*
 🚀
 **Why Mevisio?**
 When walking into the office at Mevisio, you will meet passionate, collaborative, and kind people. We are a fast-growing SaaS company underway to visualize the manufacturing industry and redefine its future. To succeed - we need more awesome people like YOU on our team!
   

  

 We love cross-functional collaboration and value your thoughts both in engineering and developing the product. We challenge ourselves to become better in everything that we do where each individual matters! We work hard to be a workplace where we feel motivated and engaged and we have a fantastic platform and market to conquer - let’s do that together! 🎆
   

  

 🔍
 **About the role?**
 As a Fullstack Engineer at Mevisio, you'll join a dynamic cross-functional product team dedicated to a well-defined product discovery and delivery process. You will have the chance to hone your skills by building and enhancing our innovative low-code platform, which seamlessly integrates programming, API design, and various languages within the actual product.
   

  

 Our ideal candidate boasts strong frontend expertise and a passion for sharing knowledge with the team. Given that our platform heavily relies on data visualization, evolving the frontend architecture and platform is crucial as we expand. You'll face exciting challenges such as making the architecture more robust, automating testing, refining our design system, and tackling performance-related issues.
   

  

 We embrace a fullstack strategy, fostering true team collaboration. You'll work with technologies like GraphQL, Node.js, MongoDB, Redis, and Elasticsearch, and we expect you to be confident in these areas. Our frontend is built on React and React Native.
   

  

*What else can you expect in your daily work?*
 🔹 Discover, Define, Develop and Deliver features and capabilities within our digital management platform
   

  

 🔹 Fixing bugs, improving performance, and ensuring compatibility across browsers and devices
   

  

 🔹 Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality according to standards and best practices
   

  

 🔹 Dive deep into complex technical challenges, from backend infrastructure to frontend interfaces
   

  

 🔹 Contribute to a culture of continuous learning and growth
   

  

 💪
 **What we think you will bring to us!**
 🔹 Master's Degree in Computer Science
   

  

 🔹 5+ years of relevant working experience with tech
   

  

 🔹 Passion for technology and a constant hunger for innovation
   

  

 🔹 A collaborative spirit and excellent communication skills
   

  

 🔹 A great mindset of team spirit, inspiration and knowledge sharing to colleagues
   

  

**Other Perks And Benefits**
 🏖️ 30 paid holidays
   

  

 🤸🏻 Attractive wellness contribution
   

  

 📈 Pension plan
   

  

 🔕 Flexible working hours and hybrid office set-up
   

  

 🧑🏾‍💻 New tech gear - got that covered
   

  

 👨‍👩‍👧 Work-life balance
   

  

 ⛷️ Team gatherings
   

  

 🏢 Central Office
   

  

***If you think this sounds cool - don't miss out the chance to meet this fantastic team!***
 Every year, Deloitte ranks Sweden's fifty fastest growing technology companies, in their Sweden Technology Fast 50 list. With a revenue growth of 914% over the last four years, 2018-2021, Mevisio made it to number 34 on the list. Adding to the achievement, the growth has been made with no external funding.
   

  

 – We are glad to see that our hard work has payed off. We are a small, dedicated team that is committed to providing an enterprise grade platform to our customers with the best user experience there is. Our customers have tough requirements when it comes to service delivery and information security—every new customer is an achievement. I'm really proud of the team that has made this possible, says Marcus Wejderot, CEO of Mevisio.

title: Test Engineer
description:
Are you ready to be at the forefront of shaping the energy infrastructure for the future?
 



  





 Our society is undergoing a significant green industrial revolution. To keep pace with the rate of electrification and renewable energy expansion we need to be installing 10 MW of Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) every other week until 2030. Multiply that figure by 10 when considering wider Europe.
 



  





 At Stella Futura, we aim to address these challenges and ensure the energy supply for the future. We achieve this by designing, owning, and operating BESS facilities across Sweden and the Nordics. Rooted in engineering expertise, focusing on financial innovation and flexible commercial solutions, we pioneer new modern energy infrastructure across the country.
 



  





**About the Role:** 



* Conduct electrical, thermal, and mechanical tests on BESS components and systems.
* Develop detailed testing plans, procedures, and protocols for product features and safety measures.
* Analyse specifications and technical data to ensure compliance with regulatory standards and safety protocols.
* Prepare detailed test reports and present test results to stakeholders, summarising findings and providing recommendations for improvements.
* Provide expert guidance to project and installation teams based on testing outcomes and active contribution to troubleshooting activities.
* Identify potential areas of improvement and innovation in battery systems and inverter technologies.
* Oversee the day-to-day operations of test facilities, ensuring they are well-equipped, well-maintained and organised.
* Manage and maintain meticulous technical documentation, test reports, schedules and compliance records in accordance with established protocols.



  





**Who We're Seeking:** 



* Relevant education in electrical, electronic or power engineering, or a related field with a focus on energy systems.
* Minimum of 3-5 years of professional experience in engineering within battery technology, energy systems, or a related field.
* Strong expertise in testing methodologies, including test plan development, test execution, and results analysis.
* Deep technical understanding and a keen interest in energy issues, safety standards, and regulatory compliance.
* Proficiency in evaluation tools, software and programming languages, such as CAD, MATLAB Simulink, R and Python.
* Excellent communication skills in English. Proficiency in Swedish is of merit.



  





**To Succeed in This Role:** 




 We're looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and can effectively carry out multifaceted projects. Your strategic mindset, coupled with a strong work ethic and attention to detail, will be key to driving project success. We value qualities like curiosity, adaptability, decisiveness, and a commitment to continuous improvement and knowledge sharing. As a member of our team, we expect you to take initiative in driving both your own professional growth and the development of our company.
 



  





**What we offer:** 



* A unique growth journey with the opportunity to shape the future of energy infrastructure.
* An annual training budget and certification support.
* The chance to work with innovative technologies on exciting projects.
* An international workplace characterised by entrepreneurship and team spirit, where we support each other to succeed and advance towards a more sustainable future.



  





 Ready to make a difference? Apply now to join our team and be part of shaping the future of energy.
 



  





**About Stella Futura:** 




 Stella Futura is technology-independent and offers market-leading sustainable energy solutions that include both battery systems and solar installations. Our customers include industries, public institutions, and commercial properties. A key aspect is to offer business setups and financing solutions with financial partners that make it possible for customers to purchase the energy solution as a service, without heavy initial investments. By combining deep engineering expertise with new financing solutions, Stella Futura creates the conditions for a rapid green transition for its customers. The company operates in Sweden. It is owned by the founders and Profura. The headquarters is centrally located in Gamla stan, Stockholm.
 



  





 Want to know more about us? Listen to our podcast
 **here** 
 . Learn more about the benefits of our battery systems
 **here** 
 .

title: Automation Tester
description:
**The Role**
 We are looking for a Senior test automation software engineer who is open to learning and adapting to ever-evolving techniques within our talented team of developers. We work with Mission Critical products to fine tune the experiences of millions of end users – there's nearly zero downtime, so you will need to be excellent at what you do.
   

  

 We are looking for a software tester focusing on backend and automation to join us, we this role open in Stockholm (Sweden), Gibraltar.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a tester in our team include testing our modern and reusable components, that build up the entire customer facing sports betting experience. Our test engineers drive the automation forward by writing test cases, improving the framework, suggesting improvements to the process, the tools and the product, as well as staying on top of requirements and generally being an ambassador for great quality. We are a cross-functional team, so working closely with frontend, backend and native developers is a natural part of the work. A tester in our team participates all aspects of the work, from initial planning and setting up requirements to writing automation tests and handling issues.
   

  

 Your expertise lies within Java and test automation but there will be opportunities to technically support your colleagues on other technical domains as well. You will be eager to take ownership and develop reliable test automation and plan and drive quality forward. Occasional travel may be needed as our domain is spread across multiple locations.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Conduct testing on modern and reusable components to enhance the customer-facing sports betting experience.
* Drive automation efforts by writing test cases, improving frameworks, suggesting process enhancements, and advocating for product quality.
* Collaborate closely with frontend, backend, and native developers in a cross-functional team environment.
* Participate in all aspects of the work, including initial planning, requirement setup, automation test writing, and issue resolution.
* Provide technical support to colleagues on various technical domains as needed.
* Take ownership of test automation, develop reliable automation solutions, and spearhead quality initiatives.
* Occasionally travel to multiple locations as our domain spans across different regions.


**Requirements:**
* Proficiency in Java and test automation, with a willingness to learn and adapt to evolving techniques.
* Hands on experience with TestNG or RestAssured.
* Experience with Java frameworks such as Spring, Spring Boot, and Hibernate.
* Knowledge of JSON, Python, Restful APIs, and socket-based APIs.
* Exposure to Kafka, Solace Queue, RabbitMQ, or similar messaging systems.
* Familiarity with Selenium, Appium, Cucumber, and Cypress.
* Understanding of databases like Oracle and Couchbase.
* Familiarity with version control systems like Git, build tools like Maven, and containerization platforms like Docker and Kubernetes.
* Some exposure to performance testing techniques.
* Experience with Continuous Integration and Delivery practices.
* Strong understanding of best development practices and Agile/Lean values

title: Game Client Framework Developer
description:
Hacksaw Studios are looking for experienced developers to work with our framework for developing casino game clients. We are a relatively young company, but has quickly grown to be a top developer of casino-style games for the iGaming industry. Remote is possible, but we prefer if you are based in EU.
 



  





**The Role:** 




  





 As a framework developer you will work together with the game development teams to deliver features and tools that they need, as well as doing maintenance, bugfixes and performance or usability improvements on existing code. You need to be able to consider all the aspects of implementing a feature, how it affects long term developer productivity and/or memory, GPU and CPU performance. The framework team also handle for example CI pipelines, e2e tests and client integrations, and depending on your skills or interests there are plenty of different technologies to explore.
 



  





 There are very few meetings and a lot of freedom and responsibility to prioritize and specify scope of work, so a great opportunity if you are good at communicating to find the right solution, but also like to be productive and have time to focus on individual tasks.
 



  





**Relevant Experience/Skills:** 




  





 \* Worked with different game development frameworks and some understanding of how they handle structuring of code and rendering of graphics and sound. Ideally with games targeting web for deployment.
 



  





 \* Experience with developing modules and API's to be used by other developers.
 



  





 \* We use Haxe as a programming language for the game clients, but the role does not require previous experience. Haxe should be familiar and quick to learn if you have experience with any C-like language like C#, Java, C++, ActionScript, JS or TS, but if you only have experience with for example OCAML, Haskell or Clojure we would still like to hear from you.
 



  





 \* Our tech stack includes git, TypeScript, Linux, bash, npm, Bun, Docker, Cucumber, GitLab and AWS. Familiarity with any of those tools are beneficial but not required.

title: Senior AI Engineer, 2 Hour Learning (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, 2 Hour Learning. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Are you a full-stack AI wizard ready to redefine the frontier of K-12 learning? Join the education revolution at 2 Hour Learning!
   

  

 At 2 Hour Learning, we're not just talking about transforming education - we're proving it with hard data. Our learning ecosystem harnesses cutting-edge AI, learning science, and psychometrics to create a digital learning environment that's twice as effective as traditional schooling. High schoolers ace AP exams, middle schoolers advance 2 grade levels per year, and even kindergarteners shatter learning goals.
   

  

 You'll play a pivotal role in architecting this AI-powered learning revolution. You'll wield autonomy and creative freedom to envision, code, and ship sophisticated full-stack applications and interactive AI tools that engage students and drive learning efficiency to unprecedented heights.
   

  

 This isn't a role for AI dabblers or back-end-only coders. We seek bold AI architects who can seamlessly weave AI magic across front-end interfaces, back-end algorithms, and end-to-end product experiences. You'll own and optimize the entire product lifecycle, partnering closely with stakeholders to ensure we're nailing learner needs.
   

  

 If you're energized by leveraging generative AI breakthroughs to tangibly level up learning for thousands of students and unafraid to challenge educational norms in the process, this is your frontier. Bring your A-game in full-stack development, AI acumen, and agile leadership - and let's reshape education for the AI era, one innovative application at a time.
   

  

 For more information on 2 Hour Learning, visit our website [https://2hourlearning.com/] and the Future of Education Instagram page [https://www.instagram.com/futureof\_education/]. To see a school built around 2 Hour Learning, check out Alpha [https://alpha.school/].
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Architecting and coding interactive full stack web applications that harness advanced AI to enable personalized, accelerated learning
* Continually experimenting with and integrating the latest generative AI tech to pioneer novel educational experiences
* Owning end-to-end product lifecycle, from gathering requirements to development, launch and iterative enhancement
* Partnering with stakeholders to align development with learner needs and garner insights to fuel cycles of innovation
* Leveraging AI-driven automation across testing, debugging and beyond to maximize development velocity and robustness


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Coding narrow AI features in isolation of overarching product goals and learner needs
* Implementing AI in a superficial, "buzzwordy" way that doesn't drive material learning gains
* Toiling away at small-scale internal demos; your applications will drive learning impact for thousands
* Waiting for others to define product requirements or conduct user research; you'll lead the charge
* Wasting hours on manual QA; you'll leverage AI-powered testing to maximize efficiency


**Senior AI Engineer Key Responsibilities**
 Develop and deliver engaging, human-centered AI applications that demonstrably accelerate learning outcomes and efficiency for thousands of K-12 students.
   

  

**Basic Requirements**
* 3+ years full stack development experience with frameworks like React, Angular, Node.js, Django, etc.
* Extensive experience leveraging large language models (LLMs) like GPT-4, Claude or Codex
* Proven track record successfully managing the full product lifecycle, including research, requirement gathering, design, development, launch, and feedback gathering
* Hands-on experience with large language models (LLMs) such as ChatGPT, Copilot, Gemini, or Claude, integrating these AI solutions into web applications
* Outstanding communication skills to champion ideas and interact with users
* Passion for pushing the boundaries of generative AI to revolutionize how the world learns


**About 2 Hour Learning**
 2hr Learning is powered by AI technology that enables schools to provide personalized, mastery learning to students, enabling them to learn faster than standard school, thereby freeing up the rest of the school day to pursue their passions and interests.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

title: Senior Solution Developer to Core Ledger
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Team Inlån Dev is looking for an Assembler/COBOL developer with a strong technical drive to join our existing team based in Stockholm.
   

  

 You will be part of a professional team on a great transformative journey. One of SEB’s largest initiatives is found within the Core Ledger area where we are building a completely new ledger system. The current system INLÅN, (even known as the
 *Heart of the Bank* 
 ) is a deposit system in SEK, containing all the banks’ customers’ deposit- accounts; both private and cooperative will slowly be phased out. The system is built by SEB and runs on Mainframe.
   

  

 Meanwhile developing the new ledger, securing our current business to be run with the same quality and efficiency as it has been since 1970, is still our major focus.
   

  

**The team is accountable for:**
* Development and testing within the SEK deposit account ledger, INLÅN.
* Development and testing of common CS services within deposit application.
* Automation of tests
* LCM-activities


 Cross-collaboration and interaction with other SEB teams with a focus on accuracy and timely delivery are the essence of our daily work.
   

  

**Your primary responsibilities will include:**
* Develop and testing of services for INLÅN on the KTO platform and IMS/DB2
* Development and enabling of SEB’s largest initiatives (New Cash Ledger)
* Share information via MQ/KAFKA
* Analysis and design work
* Collaborating with people in our team and cross-teams


**Who We Are Looking For**
 We believe you are an outgoing and positive team player who has a flexible mindset and a willingness to drive larger initiatives. You like to find creative solutions to complex problems. Since we are an agile team, using Scrum and SAFE as frameworks it is an advantage if you have worked in similar setups before. An analytical and curious mindset and previous experience in design work are well needed to succeed in this role. As a person, you are communicative, driven, and collaborative. Sharing knowledge comes naturally to you.
   

  

 Furthermore, to succeed we think you have:
   

  

* Good knowledge of Assembler
* Good knowledge of Cobol and Mainframe environments e.g JCL, DB2, MQ, and KAFKA
* Fluent in English, both orally and written
* Proven track record of analytical/design work


**We offer**
 We are a team of 18 highly motivated and engaged developers and testers. Always looking out for each other. We would love to welcome you to join our journey of future-proofing SEB’s core systems.
   

  

* Agile and modern way of working
* Deliver world-class service to customers
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Work-life balance
* Mentorship


**About**
**Learn more about working at SEB at www.sebgroup.com/career at**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.
   

  

**Ready to join?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than August the 31st 2024. If you have questions about the position please contact Linda Asplund, Team Manager, by mail at linda.asplund@seb.se

title: Lead Software Engineering – SRE (Bangkok-based, Relocation Provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 Lead Software Engineer in SRE is a part of data team who developing solutions for analytic production incidents, we are working close with our DevOps engineers, NOC, QA, and service owners to improve system reliability with an emphasis on safe deployment and monitoring with anomaly detection technique.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Help establish and apply SRE best practices, standards and policies in hybrid cloud environments with hybrid workloads where both VMs and containers are used
* Develop systems to prevent outages through automatic detection and remediation
* Increase observability of system health to improve availability and system uptime
* Providing guidance and expertise to the team
* Influence, design and create new architectures, standards and methods for large-scale enterprise systems
* Document and present methodologies to operations, engineering and executive teams
* Coach and develop software engineers, looks for opportunities to improve both technical and people through highly effective 1-1s and growth plans


**What You’ll Need to Succeed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems/Engineering/related field
* 4+ years in a technical role supporting IT products
* Ability to multitask and pivot when necessary in a fast-paced environment
* Hands-on experience with the whole SDLC: Requirement, Design, Code, Test, Deploy
* Deep understanding of computer networks
* Proficient in at least one programming language (e.g. Ruby, JavaScript/NodeJS, Python)
* Understanding of VMs, docker/rkt containers and their applications, K8s, private cloud knowledge is plus
* Hands-on experience designing and implementing monitoring and alerting systems
* Experience in Data platforms like SQL or Hadoop
* Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
* Incident management process, analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience & can lead the incident
* Can do attitude (sometime we build news thing)
* Data driven & Data analyze skill, we move forward using data

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Data Governance Engineer, Stockholm/Copenhagen
description:
We seek to strengthen our position and increase the speed of our digital transformation, and we are looking for you who will play an important role in identifying and implementing top notch data governance throughout the company.
 **Data** 
 The Advanced Analytics & Automation team is responsible for establishing the future IT landscape that will be the foundation for our data driven journey. PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics and as a part of the IT organisation, we support a variety of different PostNord stakeholders in a multitude of areas using our Azure-based Data Platform as our base. It is our goal to create scalable solutions to support the development of valuable data solutions and address broad range of use cases from logistics operations, self-service reporting and advanced analytics for companywide innovation and transformation initiatives.
   

  

**Job Duties**
 As a Data Governance Engineer, you are the IT representative responsible for the governance and safeguarding of our valuable data assets. You'll be a part of our analytics centre of excellence and the main stakeholder for governance tools and procedures, as well as representing the data owner perspective on the data assets to the data architect and the different teams delivering the platform and analytics solutions.
   

  

 In this role, you'll have the opportunity to work on a wide range of projects and initiatives and get to know data and business representatives from all over the company. This is a new role at not PostNord and your first task will be to set up a structured processes and channels that ensures data ownership within the organization, by assigning and leading business representative data stewards in working on compliance, completeness, and quality feedback loops.
   

  

 Even though situated in an IT organisation, this role is anything but solely focused on technical aspects of data management, and you’ll most likely move between subjects from legal aspects such as privacy and security to organisational development, disaster recovery and business continuity planning. You will however be working with hands on with cataloguing and lineage, including the technical tools, and you should be able to understand and manage a wide range of data types and formats.
   

  

 The tech stack still varies from team to team, but for data platform we are mainly focused on the Azure stack, (among the services used are Azure Auto ML, Azure ML Ops, Data Bricks, Data Factory, Synapse, Azure DevOps CI/CD, Microsoft Power and Power BI etc). Our RPA team primarily work with UIPath and the Microsoft Power Platform.
   

  

 We prefer to use Agile, and our unit applies a pragmatic approach to SAFe to resolve dependencies and set the pace for development, but we choose the appropriate approach for the product and team.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You are either a technical person that thrives in the domain of processes and policies, or you have a background in organisational development but a curiosity in data and analytics. We imagen that our ideal candidate would be the lawyer, librarian, clerk, or curator with a hobby as a self-taught data scientist.
   

  

 It is important that you are comfortable to work closely with a multitude of stakeholders, ranging from tech geeks to strategy yuppies, and that you are result-oriented enough to not only identifying what needs to be done within your area of responsibility, but also be hands-on in executing on the road towards the target state.
   

  

**Requirements**
 We look for persons that can grow in a role. We don’t have a long list of specific requirements, but expect you to have:
   

  

* Proven track record of organizational development, project management, team leadership or similar experience in a context requiring change management,
* Cloud literacy and understanding of how modern IT solutions create business value.
* Knowledge of, or curiosity in databases, data warehousing, big data platforms and data visualization tools.


 Meriting
   

  

* A relation to and clear opinion about agile philosophy and servant leadership
* Experience of data management or data governance


 We accept applications from all of EU but would require a remote colleague to be willing to work on site on a regular basis.
   

  

**We offer you**
* Work in a Nordic and dynamic environment.
* Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and health center.
* Employee benefits through PostNord’s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus .
* Great occupational pension terms.
* Great development opportunities and a continuous learning culture.
* Employment in Stockholm or Copenhagen.


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
**We will start reviewing applications in the beginning of August**
 We look forward to receive your application! If you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact Pernille Skovborg on pernille.skovborg@postnord.com
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: Facklig kontakt | PostNord
   

  

 We are looking forward to hear from you!

title: Senior Statistical Programmer
description:
**Global Biostatistics**
**Home-based, office-based, hybrid options available**
**Join us on our exciting journey!**
 The Global Biostatistics (Data Sciences, Safety & Medical) team at IQVIA are experienced in submissions for all major regions; working together with key groups such as, Global Regulatory Affairs, Safety, Project and Data Management, and Medical Writing, to drive efficiency and accountability.
   

  

 IQVIA Biostatistics helps interpret and draw inferences from data collected on patients as they progress through a clinical trial and serves as the bridge between data capture and reporting.
   

  

 We have one of the largest Biostatistics departments within the industry of around 1,100+ staff, to which we engage the full range of industry-leading resources and expertise spanning all study phases and therapeutic areas.
   

  

**Job Overview:**
 As a Senior Statistical Programmer, you will be given access to cutting-edge, in-house technology and opportunities to work on global projects across a variety of therapeutic areas.
   

  

 Thanks to our development opportunities and mentoring at all levels, you will be able to progress your long-term career in the direction you choose.
   

  

 You will provide experienced technical expertise to develop process methodology for the department to meet internal and external clients’ needs.
   

  

 You will plan and coordinate the development of integrated programming solutions, serving the full spectrum of statistical programming needs, along with providing technical expertise and leadership to the department and provide internal consulting services, including specifications and user needs analysis for complex project or client requirements.
   

  

 Acting as a lead on studies, you will directly communicate with internal and client statisticians and clinical team members to ensure appropriate understanding of requirements and project timelines and support the training of new or junior team members. As well as, estimating programming scope of work, manage resource assignments, communicate project status and negotiate/re-negotiate project timelines for deliverables.
   

  

**Requirements:**
* Bachelors or Masters’ in Computer Science, Mathematics or equivalent
* 5+ years Statistical Programming experience within the Life-Science industry
* Experience in SAS® Base, and good knowledge of SAS® graph and SAS® Macros
* Excellent knowledge of CDISC standards (SDTM and ADaM)
* Excellent application development skills
* Strong understanding of clinical trial data and extremely hands on in data manipulations, analysis and reporting of analysis results.
* Experience as technical team lead, directly engaging clients and coordinating tasks within a programming team
* In-depth knowledge of applicable clinical research regulatory requirements, i.e. Good Clinical Practice
* (GCP) and International Conference on Harmonization (ICH) guidelines


**Join IQVIA to see where your skills can take you**
* Global exposure
* Variety of therapeutic areas
* Collaborative and supportive team environment
* Access to cutting-edge and innovative, in-house technology
* Excellent career development and progression opportunities
* Work-Life Balance, with a strong focus on a positive well-being


**Unleash your potential!**
 It takes passion to make the extraordinary possible for patients. Our culture of innovation and collaboration enables us to explore new possibilities and help improve health around the world.
   

  

 When you join our diverse, global team, you’ll harness the power of unparalleled data, advanced analytics, cutting-edge technologies, and deep healthcare and scientific expertise to drive healthcare forward.
   

  

 IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com
